document.title: Rhode Island K-12 Grade Span Expectations in the Arts - Visual Arts & Design

48386080DFE70131758D68A86D17958E.description: comparing one's own work with the work of others by recognizing similarities and differences of subject matter, colors and shapes

48381460DFE70131758C68A86D17958E.description: contributing in individual or group discussions about work in which the student gives and receives constructive criticism

4837D1E0DFE70131758B68A86D17958E.description: asking questions about other's artwork relating to subject matter, colors, and shapes to gain a deeper understanding of the artwork's meaning (e.g., Why is there so much red?)

483791B0DFE70131758A68A86D17958E.description: describing subject matter, colors, shapes, and story seen in a work of art or design using affirmative statements

48374A90DFE70131758968A86D17958E.description: Students reflect upon, analyze and evaluate the work of self and others by…

4836FA00DFE70131758868A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic – Applying knowledge of Visual Art and Design in order to reflect on and evaluate the work of self and others.

0F5CD1379E9349819F4CD89FC3D8263B.description: indentifying subject matter and basic feelings evoked (e.g., a mother loving her child)

579337C13B854675B3CB57ED06509BD9.description: Students demonstrate the ability to extract meaning from works of art by…

48369320DFE70131758768A86D17958E.description: identifying how their own works of art or design are symbolic representations of events, ideas, feelings, or beliefs

48364C30DFE70131758668A86D17958E.description: identifying how visual symbols in everyday life represent meaning (e.g., red traffic lights tell us to stop; packages with friendly cartoon characters tell us that the product is good)

48361060DFE70131758568A86D17958E.description: exploring the use of colors, shapes, and lines to create a unique expression representing a feeling, idea or meaning

4835D340DFE70131758468A86D17958E.description: exploring media, techniques, processes, and visual arts and design concepts to convey feelings, ideas, or meaning

483595C0DFE70131758368A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate the ability to communicate in the language of Visual Art and Design by…

48355870DFE70131758268A86D17958E.description: Communication – Visual Art and Design is a vehicle for expression and communication through the use and development of metaphor and symbol systems.

48351C60DFE70131758168A86D17958E.description: recognizing how the visual arts and design are different and similar in different cultures or times

4834DD70DFE70131758068A86D17958E.description: Identifying a variety of things that an artist does (e.g. designing shoes, desks, packaging, creating expressive images and sculptures)

483496B0DFE70131757F68A86D17958E.description: recognizing connections between Visual Arts and Design and other disciplines (e.g., clothes are designed by artists; scientists study objects by drawing them)

48345B30DFE70131757E68A86D17958E.description: identifying a variety of purposes for making visual art and design (e.g., telling a story, communicating ideas and emotions, creating functional objects)

48341D70DFE70131757D68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the role of Visual Art and Design in personal, cultural, and historical contexts by…

4833DFE0DFE70131757C68A86D17958E.description: Cultural Contexts – Visual Art and Design creatively expresses the values and ideas of human experience, community, and civilization.

4833A200DFE70131757B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrating knowledge of basic art vocabulary relating to describing lines, colors, and shapes

48336230DFE70131757A68A86D17958E.description: recognizing and exploring media, tools, techniques, and processes while creating two- and three-dimensional works of art and design (e.g., media, tools, and techniques in drawing, painting, mixed media, sculpture, ceramics, digital media)

48330D60DFE70131757968A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate knowledge and skill of media, tools, techniques, and processes of Visual Art and Design by…

4832CBC0DFE70131757868A86D17958E.description: maintaining a portfolio of self-created art work and explaining basic art concepts learned

48328B90DFE70131757768A86D17958E.description: exploring visual representation based on observation

483247C0DFE70131757668A86D17958E.description: experimenting with a variety of strategies and techniques to address artistic problems (e.g., "What colors will I use to make a cloudy sky?")

483209B0DFE70131757568A86D17958E.description: identifying and exploring basic VAD concepts: line, shape, form, texture, color, pattern, and contrast

4831C7C0DFE70131757468A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate knowledge and application of Visual Art and Design concepts by…

483172A0DFE70131757368A86D17958E.description: Creative Processes – Visual Art and Design is the process of creative problem solving using both traditional and innovative media, tools, techniques, and processes in order to make the imagined visible.
